title: Folder Alias
content:
folder-alias extension # Rating (1 to 5 stars) # ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Summary # Adds annotations to the right of folders and files in the Explorer.
Usage # Right-click the folder or file you want to add a remark (alias) for. Select “Add Alias”. Enter the remark and press Enter. The remark will appear in the file tree. You can manage remarks in either of the following ways:
Right-click the file or folder, select “Add Alias”, and enter the desired remark. Right-click the file or folder, select “Add Alias”, and modify an existing remark. How it works # The extension automatically creates a folder-alias.json file in your project. It is a JSON file. If you edit this file directly, run the VS Code command “Developer: Reload Window” to refresh the annotations.
{ "LICENSE": { // folder or file "description": "Open source license" // annotation to display } }
